description:
As an Integrated Circuit Product Engineer, you will play a key role in creating new consumer electronic products that meet a high bar for reliability and performance. You will work closely with the product management and design engineering teams to define standards, specify tests, and then supervise test execution and failure analysis. A broad engineering background and command of statistical methods will help to inform design of new products. Your strong interpersonal and communication skills will be key to ensuring adoption of your technical recommendations.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of semiconductor engineering experience in product engineering.
  • Experience with silicon failure analysis methods and closing reliability issues with foundries or IP providers. Experience with debug of digital, analog, and memory IP.
  • Experience with Python and C-code.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience launching new products into high volume, on time.
  • Familiarity with common failure analysis tools and methodologies (CSAM, SEM, FIB, X-Ray imaging, Nanoprobing, Delayering).
  • Knowledge of CPU/bus architecture, memory controller, high-speed interface modules, and mixed-signal/analog macros.
  • Understanding of digital/analog circuit design, standard cell characterization and design, physical layout, and spice modeling.
responsibilities:
• Define Automatic Test Equipment (ATE) characterization test plans and generate characterization reports. Finalize test limits and define production guard-bands based on ATE-bench correlations and Payment Verification Token (PVT) characterization results.
  • Work with multi-functional teams to debug, root cause and implement corrective actions on diverse failure mechanisms. Work with Design and Test Engineers to identify potential yield improvement plans prior to mass production release.
  • Support Quality Assurance and Reliability teams with diverse product qualification requirements (HTOL board design, Burn-in shift analysis, reliability guard-band).
  • Own silicon product qualification plans and execution. Track on target percentage/test revisions and associated part numbers maintenance throughout the product development life cycle.
  • Perform statistical data analyses on mass production data. Define milestones and communicate product development schedule to the team.
title: Integrated Circuit Product Engineer
